metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9221 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
strongSwan 4.5.x through 5.2.x before 5.2.1 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (invalid pointer dereference) via a crafted IKEv2Key Exchange (KE) message with Diffie-Hellman (DH) group 1025.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstrongswan - 5.1.2-0ubuntu4
strongswan - 5.1.2-0ubuntu4
strongswan-ike - 5.1.2-0ubuntu4
strongswan-ikev1 - 5.1.2-0ubuntu4
strongswan-ikev2 - 5.1.2-0ubuntu4
strongswan-nm - 5.1.2-0ubuntu4

criterions.comment: strongswan package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.2-0ubuntu4').
